Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of heat in killing the novel coronavirus, suggesting that it can completely eliminate the virus in just four days.
Understate: The claim understates the severity of the COVID-19 situation in China by suggesting that people have stopped going to hospitals for treatment, when in fact there are ongoing hospitalizations and imported cases.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or scientific basis to support the effectiveness of heat in killing the virus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that steam inhalation, hot gargles, and drinking hot tea can kill the virus, without considering the lack of scientific evidence and potential harm to human health.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that people in China continue to go to hospitals for COVID-19 treatment, as reported by Chinese media.
